main event: Unidentified object with the appearance of a bright star was sighted in the Pacific at 21.30N 158.03W.
interesting points: The object appeared to move horizontally and vertically about 5 degrees.
The object dropped about 20 to 25 degrees in 15 minutes before disappearing on the horizon.
There were clouds in the sky, but not in the area of the object.
The observer went inside and came back out about 15 minutes later, at which point the object had dropped in elevation.
The object was described as having the appearance of a bright star, likely Sirius, and the misidentification was probably due to unusual atmospheric conditions and an active imagination.
sighted object: Unidentified object with the appearance of a bright star
